subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Frank or any other electronics guru, please help!!
author: Debbie Tejada
full_text:
Zack,

I'm hoping I can get some help from Frank S since he lives close to  
me. If that doesn't work out for some reason, I'd be glad to mail the  
camera to you if you (you're not in New Zealand or something?), pay  
you for your work and shipping for return. Would that work?

Deb T.

On Dec 31, 2007, at 7:49 AM, Zack Widup wrote:

>
> Hi Debbie,
>
> What everyone else has said is correct. OUCH! The pc board is now
> damaged.
>
> I can't quite tell how bad it is from the photo. It might be  
> repairable
> but probably not with the original connector. That would have to be
> removed and the wires soldered directly to the board. The board itself
> would have to be repaired also, by someone who has experience in  
> repairing
> such things.
>
> I could probably do that, as I worked in electronics repair for over  
> 10
> years, but I live quite a ways from you.
>
> Zack
>
> On Mon, 31 Dec 2007, Debbie Tejada wrote:
>
> > Okay, one of my DIY projects this weekend has been to convert my
> > husband's old Olympus to infrared. We're not extremely talented in  
> the
> > electronics area, but we have fun and seem to muddle by. No guts no
> > glory, huh?
> >
> > Well, for the most part the operation has been a success. I
> > photographed every step of the way and taped screws and parts to the
> > photos so we'd know how to rebuild everything we took apart, and  
> that
> > has worked just fine. I located the IR filter, removed it and cut  
> and
> > replaced it with a piece of glass slide.
> >
> > The one problem we ran into is that there were two wires that  
> appeared
> > to be clipped in place as opposed to being soldered or screwed in  
> like
> > everything else. When we tried to pry the clips open, instead the
> > whole thing came off the circuit board. WE HAVE NO CLUE HOW TO  
> PROCEED
> > FROM HERE. I don't know if we can just glue the darn things down and
> > if so, what type of glue to use, or if we're just plain up the  
> creek.
> >
> > I immediately thought of this group of brainy electronics buffs. I'm
> > hoping someone out there can give us some advice, or if you live  
> near
> > Highlands Ranch, CO, you could help in person & bail us out of  
> this. I
> > was hoping to take this camera to the St. Augustine Lighthouse at  
> the
> > end of this coming week.
> >
> > Is there any hope? I've posted a photo of an extreme closeup of the
> > clips (one is pink, the other is ivory) and the damaged board -- I  
> had
> > to sandwich two photos together to get both in focus at the same  
> time
> > (that's why it looks that way). For an idea of scale, the clips are
> > both the same size, about 4 mm in width, 4 mm tall, 3 mm deep. Not
> > easy to handle and even harder to see with these middle age eyes.
> > http://www.tejadadesign.com/camera/splice.jpg
> >
> > Any advice would be GREATLY APPRECIATED!! Deb T.
> >
>
>
